metadata.title: CVE-2021-20292 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.description:
There is a flaw reported in the Linux kernel in versions before 5.9 indrivers/gpu/drm/nouveau/nouveau_sgdma.c in nouveau_sgdma_create_ttm inNouveau DRM subsystem. The issue results from the lack of validating theexistence of an object prior to performing operations on the object. Anattacker with a local account with a root privilege, can leverage thisvulnerability to escalate privileges and execute code in the context of thekernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20292` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required
